Reviews.Title: “It's got its positives...”
Reviews.Author: Christopher C
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2-weeks. Hotel staff are friendly and helpful to a point (if it requires too much thinking forget about it...). They have free use of laundry machines (bring your own detergent or purchase from them). They have a pool and jacuzzi (?). Internet and cable TV, but the internet can only really accomadate the basics like light web-browsing, e-mail, and such (i.e. forget Netflix). There's a park right behind the hotel with a cool running track and pull-up bars, dip bars, etc. They're gym has some cardio machines, dumbells up to 50lbs. and the trio machine of lat pulldown, leg raises, leg extensions, etc. Their's a snack bar to purchase some junk food at street prices. All-in-all, for the price (lower than others in area) you get the minimum plus some ammenities. Location is good... close to airport, Dolphin Mall, straight shot to Miami Beach. Local area has plenty of food choices.

Reviews.Title: “Good room; just needs more desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Branden55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a single night at the beginning of our vacation. The hotel is a short drive from the airport, tucked back on a side street. The room fit the bill just fine: it had a kitchenette, which we didn't need, but which was equipped with a fridge, stove, and even a little dishwasher. The free wi-fi was zippy, the bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was clean. My only quibble was with the check-in process. We got in on a Friday night, and there was only one desk clerk. A large college tennis team was checking in ahead of us, and it took about 30 minutes to take care of them and get to us. Maybe they were just short-staffed that night.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for long term stay or after trip from abroad”
Reviews.Author: wanderlite
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Candlewood Suites after returning from a trip abroad. The hotel was in decent shape, but the amenities cannot be beat. Small kitchen in the room, free internet, free laundry and pantry. We managed to get a lot of errands done before heading home. The nearby area (Doral) has a really great sushi place and Winn-Dixie. It felt like we were coming home before actually heading home. Only criticisms are that even though it looks close to the airport is a bit of a drive and one van share quoted us $22 per person to get there and the bed in our room was small for a family (queen or a large double). Overall great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place for a quick stay. Staff is very helpful!!”
Reviews.Author: xangel1
Reviews.Content: My family & I booked 2 rooms at this hotel to stay in the night before we leave for our cruise & we booked it online a month ago through hotels.com. The specific reason we chose this place is because the hotels.com rep said they offered shuttles from the airport, train station, & to the port. On the way here we found out this is not the case, they offer no shuttles! Ok so major mistake on the part of hotels.com!!! Then we had booked 2 rooms each with a queen bed & we had again been told by hotels.com that we could have roll away beds for the 2 children in each room. Mistake #2 on their part because apparently the hotel has 3 roll-aways total & they were being used!!! This is where I'm now furious at hotels.com & will NEVEr use them again... But this is also where I become impressed with Candlewood. The staff here was really accommodating & even said that usually they would suggest calling hotels.com & making them find us another place But there is a huge boat show in town?? And apparently they have all of the rooms in town booked up! So the staff found us some air mattresses for the kids & provided plenty of extra bedding to make them as comfy as possible. Overall the hotel seems pretty clean, the room is a good size complete with full fridge & small stove! The bed was super comfy so I got a great sleep too. The hotel is about 15mins from the train station, 10 from the airport, & about 15-20 from the port. All in all the hotel gave me no reason to complain, but I learned that hotels.com will book you any kind of room just to get your $ even if it doesn't have anything you were looking for!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok. Not bad. Nothing to write home about.”
Reviews.Author: AntonAnderssen
Reviews.Content: Free internet, both wired and wifi, free newspaper, free laundry machines and dryers. A little pantry with basic stuff for sale: 50 cents for a can of coke. Rooms OK, not big not small. If you searched, you could probably do better. Overall, it's a reasonable hotel for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “needs some polish but okay”
Reviews.Author: SouthJerseygirl4life
Reviews.Content: Although the young man who checked me in was very polite my suite could benefit from his polished smile. I have always enjoyed Candlewood suites all over the country and this one was okay. I would have been able to give a better review had minor maintenance issues been resolved. The shower would run simultaneously while I was filling the tub for a bath. Once in the bath when I decided to add some more hot water to my bath as I was relaxing I received a face full of hot water from the shower. It looked like someone took a sledge hammer and knocked in the water temperature control as it was cracked and smashed in. I stayed in suite 227 and it was in a good location and I enjoyed being able to look out at the park right outside of my window. Still haven't gotten used to no front desk staff between 11pm-7am since I asked for a receipt before I left and did not receive one and had no one to ask as I left for an early flight. Overall it was clean just appeared to be a little run down. Nice location as far as restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “very decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: RunnerForLife
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 1 night and we both think it is a quite decent hotel for the price. Pros: 1. the room is very clean. The cleaning lady must have done a very good job. 2. the small kitchen is quite nice.. all the pots, dishes, utensils are shinning.. Everything is very clean. 3. location is very convenient. 4. the staff in the front desk was very friendly and helpful and did her work efficiently. Cons: No free breakfast provided. I will recommend this hotel to other people.

Reviews.Title: “good value hotel in Doral”
Reviews.Author: numberoneson
Reviews.Content: seems to relatively well-managed and has decent rooms free laundry, coffee and local telephone calls small but well equipped fitness room

Reviews.Title: “Don't be panic for late arrival”
Reviews.Author: Kazuya Y
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel midnight and surprised that entrance door was locked. Looking around the entrance, there was safety box. I found sticker written my first name and instruction for after hours guest check-in. Front desk hours is 7 am - 11 pm. I struggled and managed to open the box and got my room key by asking a staff on the extension phone to help. Sleep well in quiet room. The room is a standard as same as Candlewood suites Chicago O'Hare and clean and well maintained. Air-Conditioner is noisy. Since the wall between rooms is thin and there is a door for connecting room, voice and sound of TV from the next room is noisy. There is no supermarket within walk distance, so I have to pick-up some snack and food at Candlewood Cupboard. Overall, value for money. Recommend for transit in Miami airport.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COST”
Reviews.Author: easygoer99
Reviews.Content: This hotel and its staff are disgusting. I reserved a queen size suite and received a full size and they argued with me that it was a queen. They do not clean the rooms, change linens or empty trash but once per week ,which of course you dont know until u have already checked in. You have to take your dirty towels down to the front desk yourself to receive clean ones.You have to empty your own trash. The hallways smelled of marijuana the entire time we we're there and there is never anyone at the front desk to complain to, just a bell to ring which no one ever answers. I am a Travel Agent and I am telling all....STAY AWAY. The management of Michelle -- and Pier -- are an absolute joke who never contacted me back although I left messages, email and a certified letter. DISGUSTING!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, met all our requirements, very good price”
Reviews.Author: dlw19
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all our needs however the hotel has a very run-down feel, and standard staff just doing their jobs. Facilities were excellent and car park and directions equally brilliant. If this hotel wants to improve, better lighting is needed, staff ought to be trained with more outgoing customer service and a bigger goal would be a general revamp to keep up with competition. Nevertheless, the price of the room was excellent and therefore for the product was good value. Would return if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: 35745Pat
Reviews.Content: This place was great. It has free laundry facilities, easy access to WalMart for food you can cook in your own kitchen in the suites. Exercise room and pool, hot tub,and outdoor grills, all clean and working. A park and walking/running track is behind the hotel. That means quiet and peaceful. Staff was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: StraightPerson
Reviews.Content: We 2 couples were planning to stay here as one of our friend stayed here before. We had booked one queen suite but at the reception were told, its not available. Funny thing is they had confirmed my reservation just one day before that everything is set. I asked them the reason and they didn't have any explanation. They offered me two options to go for two single rooms or they will refund the difference. We obviously opted for the refund option for the difference and decided to go ahead with one single room. We stayed there for 5 days and during check out, I asked about refund. I was told that since I booked it through Expedia, the refund will go to Expedia and I will need to contact them. They didn't provide me any invoice or written proof of refund. Upon my return, I contacted Expedia, who obviously didn't have any clue about this. I decided to fight it out and conferenced Expedia and the hotel manager. Initially the hotel manager was reluctant on giving any refund. I repeatedly told her that the lady at the reception desk had promised a refund. Expedia guys also questioned the hotel for changing the room reservation without notifying them. Finally the manager gave in and agreed for the refund. I eventually got the refund from Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Going to Candlewood Suite was a trip saver!”
Reviews.Author: GettingCreative_org
Reviews.Content: We were stuck waiting at the airport in Montevideo, Uruguay for three consecutive days due to the presence of volcanic ash in the air from a recent eruption in Chile, which closed airports from Santiago to Buenos Aires to Montevideo. We watched our week long reservation evaporate daily. We had car reservations and a prepaid week at the Candlewood Suites at Miami airport West. Thankfully I was able to get in touch with Leslie Barrios who was working the front desk and asked her to please be kind enough to talk to the General Manager: Pieralberto Raccuglia and see if he would understand the situation. She kept in contact with us during our three day wait in Montevideo. We had stayed at this particular Candlewood Suite for our business trips to Miami for the last couple of years. We always enjoyed the amenities (like the free laundry, morning newspapers and a nice selection of groceries at very reasonable prices). This trip, thanks to Pieralberto and Leslie, we were checked in early as we arrived in Miami at 5:00. Leslie had our room ready and we got some needed sleep. We were able to just complete our business in the next 5 days thanks to the efficient staff who always were able to direct us to where we needed to go; and in keeping our mail and correspondence which we had forwarded in anticipation of our arrival. We changed to Candlewood Suites thanks to the personal attention which the staff has always offered and the added room size, so if you are like us and have lots of purchases or luggage you will not feel cramped and be bumping into everything as in other hotels. We cannot give this establishment and their staff a higher recommendation and we just found out on this stay that they also have a nice sized heated swimming pool with a jacuzzi as well as a work out room. Thanks to all the staff and especially to Pieralberto, Leslie, Eurica and Stephani for all those extra touches which made our stay delightful.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back. Very Clean, Very Practical, Very nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: Plattler
Reviews.Content: Despite being in the final approach of MIA airport, which produces quite some noise during the day (less at night, due to less traffic) this is a wonderful maintained and clean place. The price is very fair. The fridge and the AC unit are noisy, but you can turn it down/off for the night, the rooms stay nice an cool anyways due to the good structure of the building. spotless clean bathroom, room and kitchenette. All utensils in Kitchen, microwave, fridge, stove where like new and functioned well. Internet is slow, but free. Parking is free, seems save and well lit.

Reviews.Title: “Airplanes,Bugs and Dogs...Oh My!!!”
Reviews.Author: SummerLove2011
Reviews.Content: My Fiance, Daughter and myself stayed here for two nights. The rooms are decent as long as you tidy up first! Their shower head in the first room was leaking and about to fall out of the wall,we had to switch rooms due to a dog barking from 6:00 a.m until we moved at 12:00p.m!In the second room there was an aweful smell and the carpets were saturated..I hope with cleaner!?!? So needless to say we moved on to the final and third room where it was still a bit musty, but opening the window helped the smell, just didnt help with the constant airplane noise!! in this room there were 4 large dead bugs in plain view, if it had been cleaned they would have been found and also the shower head issue in this room as well?!? So if you like Bugs, Airplane noise and non stop barking dogs... This is the place for you!! If you would like somewhere nice, friendly and CLEAN then turn left out of the parking lot, go right at the light and then turn left into the Inter Continental Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “OK for a night's stay”
Reviews.Author: Tango-Xpress
Reviews.Content: While the name includes Airport, it takes still quite a drive to get there. In the middle of the night with low traffic, it is ok actually. I just stayed for a overnight stopover while starting my roadtrip. The room is functional, but I had hard time to move the fridge to switch it off as I need quietness for sleep. The bed was comfy and there was also working desk. Kitchen side was well-equipped, if someone would like to cook something. There is no breakfast as it is more like a residence hotel, but at least parking was free and the internet too. On check-out I could spin a lottery wheel and won 200 extra points. Other prizes could include icecream, candy-bar and some other small things.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: kaybay9387
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous after reading the reviews but it seemed to fit well into our budget, close to the airport so we wouldn't have whiney kids after traveling all day (stayed with a 3yr old and 11mo old), and the booking process was really easy so we went for it. The rooms are a fairly good size. Plenty of room to put a pack-n-play in the room with you. Bed was very comfortable! Large bathroom and big desk in the living room with a good size kitchen that even has a dishwasher. The rooms were clean and staff was nice. It isn't going to be a 4 star hotel or anything but it is a great value for the money. From what I can tell people must pay a little and expect to stay in the ritz. It was also nice and quiet. The airplanes do go right over you but we really didn't hear them and we were on the 3rd floor. The pool is a bit small but it does it's job. It has an honor system store downstairs which is nice with kids to be able to run down and get a little snack. Also free laundry which is a must with kids! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for ....and maybe less.....”
Reviews.Author: libber4884
Reviews.Content: Travelling for business picked the cheapest from the list of hotels my company recommended and, what a dissapointment. I had to call to have my room cleaned. Which they actually touched up but did not really clean. They do not pick up the rooms everyday. Everything looks cheap, old, smelly an dated all around. The hallways are darked and creepy. There is no bar or lobby treats like coffee or other. i am not staying at these chain hotels again.

Reviews.Title: “Candlewood is an all-around great value”
Reviews.Author: tklsee
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a place for picky folks who are into fancy lobbies, nightly turndown service, room-service or pay-per-view. This hotel's first impressions: fairly basic but clean and courteous. And those first impressions are indeed what this hotel is about. Check-in was fast and efficient. My room was on the second of 3 floors. I usually dread being in one of the lower levels of smaller budget hotel properties because of noise from above, but this building is solidly built and noise was never a problem from above, below or through the walls. The room was like a well laid-out bachelor apartment, with a simple but comfy queen bed, flat screen TV with HBO and 40-odd other free channels, DVD player, highly usable kitchenette with clean dishes and utensils, toaster, microwave, and a full-size fridge that was actually cold. Bathroom was perfectly fine and very clean with soft, clean towels and the air-conditioner was quiet and cold. I could see this place as a great place for long-term business-person stays. My own purpose was as a solo traveler in Miami for a golf tournament at Doral, which is a very easy 20 minute walk away. For families, there is a rudimentary, fenced in pool. For fitness buffs, there is a gym on the lower level and a park next door with a nice long jogging path. I really liked the location. Besides being close to Doral, this property happens to be off 87th, which is the last exit on 836 West before the tolls (I hate paying tolls!) and 836 is only a few minutes south. 836 then gets you anywhere fast ... airport in 10 minutes with traffic, downtown in 20 minutes (and $1.25 one-way toll), and SoBe in 25 minutes. So long as you have a car (there is plenty of free parking) and don't mind the industrial park setting, this location can't be beat. Lots of chain restaurants and smaller places all around and a Walmart/Sams Club near 836 for those interesting in stocking up their kitchenette. Final nice touch is the hotel's tuck shop which has a great selection of drinks and snacks. It operates on an honor-basis and the prices are actually really good ($0.50 for a can of soda, $4 for a pint of Haagen Dazs. Only minor beef: free wifi gets really slow during peak evening hours. I got my room for around $90 a night through Hotwire. An all-around great value!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Maria_del_Mar_I
Reviews.Content: We spend 3 nights at Candlewood Suites-Miami airport and we enjoyed staying there. Hotel is like apartment style, each room has a bathroom, a bed, a full kitchen and a table-studio. Room was very clean and bed was very comfy. The kitchen has everything you might need : toaster, coffee machine, stove, microwave, fridge, dishwasher and dishware. We would stay again here, eventhough is not close to the beach, but it is close to the airport. Very quiet. There is room service once a week, so don't expect to finf the bed done when you come back.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting bed and the worst front desk employee”
Reviews.Author: aott02
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the evening and had the misfortune to deal with a very hostile, unprofessional, and rude front desk assistant. Her name is Jennifer and I think she should be fired or hidden away from customers since she definitely has a nick for driving them away. She placed us in room 121, right in front of the front desk, which already reduces comfort due to constant traffic and loud people complaining at the front desk. The room is a handicap room, so the shower has all the gadgets, but unless you are actually handicap and in need of the assistance, this is not desirable. To make the story short, the furniture is old and beat up, and the carpet was dirty with bits of trash all around the room, but the worst was the bed. When I pulled the covers down the first thing you notice is dirt, yellow/brown stains, and dried white goo on the sheets (you can guess what that is, definitely not apple juice). Not only is this a low standard on their hygiene, and disgusting to say the least, but probably a health risk, as you are being exposed to a stranger's bodily fluids. It took me less than 60 seconds to come back out and wait in line while two other men where arguing with her to change their rooms. Sounded like the cleaning lady was also not doing her job. After she gave them new rooms it was my turn, when I explained the problem with my dirty room and politely asked if we could be switched she just looked annoyed and said they were sold out. I called the company through which I had booked it and explained the problem, they called the hotel to verify that I had requested another room and she said that I was lying, that she herself had come to the room to inspect it, and that the hotel was sold out. Clearly, all lies. She is really the worst person to have her position. Thankfully I was able to get refunded and re-booked at a much better hotel a couple of blocks away for 10 dollars cheaper. I wouldn't suggest you stay at this hotel, the front desk treats you like they are doing you a favor and forget that their rooms are not free and that they are being paid to provide a service. It should be illegal to rent out a room in that condition.

Reviews.Title: “staff not very obliging”
Reviews.Author: pw75011
Reviews.Content: Staying 4 nights, we were expecting a parcel at the hotel; everyday we asked several times for it to the staff.. And back home, we discovered that it was refused by the hotel, one day before our departure! The explanation of the manager is that it was adressed to my spouse's first name (she has the same last name that me) OK, the reservation was under my first name, but they knew we were expecting the parcel And the manager seems to find it perfect, showing how much consideration they have for their customer. Don't have any problem there!

Reviews.Title: “Room had a "cleaning materials" smell”
Reviews.Author: TravelGrandma10
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Candlewood Suites and the room was good size, the kitchen well furnished, but the room smelled like the carpet had just been cleaned. We had just gotten back from a cruise, so we took advantage of the free washers and dryers. The mattress was too soft, so we didn't sleep that well. The service was really good and the price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: AnupamaVenkitesh
Reviews.Content: This was a really pleasant, and unforgettable experience, we didnt have GPS hence struggled to find the place at midnight after we reached the airport but the hotel was worth that struggle, it was really really good. Hungry were we, but could manage to find a food store inside the hotel which was open 24 hours, u need to take ur key and get it take whatever stuff you want and believe me , they trust you, they ask u to check the price and put that in the box provided there. I loved this, they trust their customers and that is something great, the room, the bed and the windows, the curtains were all great. I simply loved the place and it is worth visiting again and i would love to visit the place again.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Illy1108
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler that has been on vacation only once this year, due to the economy. I am origianlly from Miami and visit as often as possible. I stayed in this extended stay for 1 week, acquired through a Priceline bid. We paid $40 per night. We had no problems with the room or stay there. I will comment that I have been aware tor awhile that when staying at an extended stay, they rarely accomodate more than 2 ppl and if they do, you will be charged extra, even if you got it through Priceline. I read it here. Do your research, people, My complaint is that I believe very strongly that we picked up bed bugs in this hotel. I am just finding them in my bed now, exactly 3 months after my stay, the time it takes for most infestations to begin. We had an exterminator confirm this based on the amount of bugs and time since our visit. Like I mentioned above, I have not traveled AT ALL this year other than that visit. When I return from trips, my luggage sits next to my husband's side of the bed. Guess where we found them? Only on my husband's side of the bed. All these facts add up to confirm my suspicions. I intend to contact the hotel but I don't expect anything... Just in case you don't read the news, getting rid of bedbugs is tricky and expensive. I am hoping it is not too out of control. They look like apple seeds and leave eggs and black fecal matter along the ticking and tags on your box spring and mattress. Before staying in any hotels in the future I am ripping sheets off and checking for them...

Reviews.Title: “Did not provide good service.”
Reviews.Author: jjpremier
Reviews.Content: Hotel can only accommodate two people per room because only has one bed in each room. Closes office early and refused to provide extra pillows, blankets, or towels for a family of four. We were not told that hotel only has one bed when we requested a room for four people. Terrible service, rude staff, and not interested when we wanted to reserve a second room to accommodate the rest of our party. My husband and five year old had to sleep on the ground without any pillows of blankets. I am disgusted with the service and the situation. The plane flew over all night long and made uncomfortable accommodations completely unbearable.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: bjune
Reviews.Content: The room smelled, they tried to cover it up by placing air fresheners in the ac vent. They charged my room to someone else then made me pay the bank fees for their mistake. We asked for a late checkout, went to lunch, came back and they would not let us get our things out of the room, including our little dog! Had to tell them exactly what was in the room before they would let us in. Very poor management at theis hotel. We will never stay here again. My husband had to sleep on the floor because they had no rooms available with 2 beds.

Reviews.Title: “Decent no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: jh635csi
Reviews.Content: Nothing too special about this property. The room had a small kitchen with a microwave, fairly clean, no view of anything. It is close to places to eat, gas stations, etc... Nothing too special, just kind of average. Probably won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good prices.”
Reviews.Author: HenryBrazil
Reviews.Content: It's a good choice if you have a car. Calm place, but I sugest you to prefer a bedroom in the second floor. Good price. They don't clean the bedroom everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Should be renamed Candlewood Kennels”
Reviews.Author: albertiger2
Reviews.Content: My room smelled like a dog groomers. They must have flea bombed it after someone stayed with a pet. The sheets resembled Viva paper towels and there was a stench coming from the garbage disposal. NOT a good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful - avoid at all costs.”
Reviews.Author: Mikebarford
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all: dirt, smells and fleas, plus broken airconditioning, appliances and furniture. We had three different rooms in two nights - each as bad as the one before. You will find it more comfortable and healthy sleeping in your car.

Reviews.Title: “Very dated and had a bad smell”
Reviews.Author: lanky111
Reviews.Content: I would not stay here again. The room had a stale and mildewy smell to it, was dark, small, and location was ok. About 20 minutes from miami beach. I booked a vacation package for 3 nights here with expedia since it was cheaper that way. We were only planning on staying here for 2 nights since we were going to drive out to Key west one of the days and stay there a night. Instead we ended up driving out to the Keys and just stayed in Key West the other 2 nights and never looked back! If you are looking for a good priced very nice hotel in Key West. I would recommend The Inn at Key West. Very clean, very nice, good staff, nice rooms, nice lobby, nice pool, and they had a gym too!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, nice personnel, clean home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Andi
Reviews.Content: Our 1 bedroom suite was adequately equiped with all the necessities you would need to stay for a week. in the kitchen area, stove top, dishwasher, coffee maker (with all the condiments included), refrigerator and a pantry to hold lots of food. Dishes, glasses, cooking utensils, etc. Desk area is rather sufficient to serve as a desk and table area, plenty of seating. Plenty of computer and electrical outlets. The living room had a couch (makes into a bed), a RECLINER!!, TV, VCR/DVD combo. The walls are thick to block the sound of the airplanes. The washer/dryer are free to use. They have a little convenience store where they sell drinks, juice, milk, cereal, snacks, soups, washing detergents, etc. This makes it very convenient. I highly recommend you staying here, family and kid friendly! The personnel friendly great you and help you with anything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Average- some concerns, read on...”
Reviews.Author: thecoaster
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night as part of a 2 week holiday to Florida. Had already stayed on South Beach earlier in holiday so choose here as simply needed somewhere on way back from Keys before going to Everglades. In summary, only stay here if you want somewhere close to the airport. Stayed at 6 different hotels on the holiday in Florida after consulting Trip Advisor and this was unfortunately the only one which was 'average'/ didnt meet expecations. I can only therefore advise caution with any other reviews which say its amazing !! Likes: -Spacious rooms. -Out of town ie near main road network if you are not wanting a central location as eg passing through miami/ or going to airport. -Pool. Negatives: -Difficult to find. Booked direct through Candlewood website. Had instructions on how to find it from their main website but unfortunately the last turn is incorrect. We went the opposite way to the hotel then drove around for 5 - 10 mins before finding it. Note it is near 'La Quinta', another hotel, on an industrial estate location. When we arrived the receptionist was on the phone directing someone else who was lost trying to find it !! -Price: Booked approx 6 months before went through their main website for 129 dollars exl tax then when looked a month before it was 89 dollars on their website. In retrospect after visiting it was overpriced at 129 dollars. -Check in/ deposit: I paid in cash as I had brought dollars with me on holiday but they insisted on taking an additional cash deposit of 25 dollars more as I had paid in cash and not by credit card. I have never encountered such an arrangement elsewhere and though that slightly odd. I did get it back in the morning but it added to the 'industrial estate slightly scary feel about the place. -Location: Its on an industrial estate type setting near the proximity of the airport. Yes, right under the flight path, literally. Whilst I wasnt kept awake, please be aware if you are a light sleeper that this is located on the landing path approx 1 mile from the airport. Also, its a industrial estate type setting so if you are happy literally arriving by car and thats it then its fine. If you prefer being able to walk somewhere then this isnt for you. -Lack of continental breakfast. Only hotel stayed in on this holiday with no breakfast (and for 160 dollars a night when include tax, this should be provided) Hints: Visit the 'refreshment centre' it has free coffee/ milk or essentials to buy if you have forgotten any. The pool is nice but unfortunately loses the sun in an evening. Overall, would i recommend it? Unfortunately on balance I'd have to say no, only because of its location (on a flightpath and an industrial estate). If you want easy access to the airport its fine, otherwise for a mid range location I'm sure there are better places.

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: C4MPBELL
Reviews.Content: Stopped off in Candlewood suites for 1 night after being in Tampa and a cruise.....Very surprised about the price which we thought was excellent....We had been dining out for almost 2 weeks and just wanted to have a night in.....Rooms are not luxury but were perfect for the price....Kitchen, separate bedroom...2 TVs...video......Pool and hottub area were clean (pool and hottub are very warm)....There was a gas Bar-B-Q if you wanted to use it......which we did.......videos at reception if you wanted to watch one in your room.....Little shop which uses an honour system....Free use of washing machines and tumble dryers.......We had a fab stay and would not hesitate in staying again....Very friendly staff......5 mins from two large malls (international and dolphin).....30 mins from airport, 30 mins to south beach (by car).....However this is our perception of the hotel, hope it helps..

Reviews.Title: “Scummy room, slightly scary place!”
Reviews.Author: emjharts
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night before catching a flight. After having stayed in a nice apartment in orlando for 2 weeks this was a bit of a come down! We stayed here because it was the cheapest place we could find in a 'safe' area, however, it wasn't that cheap and the area was not great either so we were disappointed. The suite room had a small basic bathroom, a small bed with very itchy covers and behind the bed it was really black and dusty, and the kitchen in the room, even though well equipped just looked bad and we had to figure out how to switch the fridge off as it was very noisy. This is also an airport hotel, so i can't really see how many people would actually use the kitchen when just on a brief stop over so is it really necessary? The actual location was probably one of the safest places around the airport. There were a few nice restaurants and bars down the road that you could probably walk to, but it would probably be better to drive at night! (the hotel had guidelines about being careful when going out to the car park alone at night etc so that scared me a bit!). Fine for a airport stop over but thats all. Not that nice at all really and certainly not worth the money paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “So Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: singingvibes
Reviews.Content: This was my husband and I first trip together and just the beginning of many trips to come. We love the place we flew in through Ft. Lauderdale, we wanted to get the chance to drive through the city into Miami "a little site seeing". You can shop or go out to eat because everything was like 5 - 10 minutes away. The front desk helped us a lot and believe me they seen my face more than enough. The girls at the front desk was wonderful and so nice. We just couldn't get over the free movie rentals so we can watch at night and the fact that it had a laundry room down the hall was great. Who wants to fly back home with dirty cloths in their suit cases, I know not me. The bed was so comfortable sometimes you didn't even want to get out of it. The rooms has a full kitchen, and excercise room down the hall if you wanted to tone up a little. I thought the area was quiet and the planes flying over the building are not loud at all, well not to me they weren't. We enjoyed the stay so much there that the third day of our stay my cousin and her friend at the last minute were flying in from out of town and she hadn't booked anything. I immediately went to the front desk and reserved her room she was so happy when she flew in the next morning that her room was all ready for her and the price was not bad at all. I would definately stay at Candlewood Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Good structure inside the bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: Julianer
Reviews.Content: Very average place but has a good bedroom, with kitchen and all the basic appliances. Perfect for a budget travel, with a car is close to everthing in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: PeterBToronto
Reviews.Content: Although it's ideal for an extended location (because each room has a kitchen) we stayed only three nights and it was just fine. It's next to a big park where you can go for a walk, and a three minute drive to several frequently used highways in Miami. It's in a light industrial area which is fine, but there are very few stores or restaurants in the area; so you need to know where they are and drive to them. It would also be fine for families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Better wake up now!”
Reviews.Author: jasPortland_OR
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night 1/31 in order to make a really early flight out of MIA the next day. Location and price were main reasons for choice. Room was nothing special but nice enough. Refrigerator lurched on and off every few minutes so we turned it off (and turned it back on the next morning). Unfortunately, we could still hear the ones (refrigerators, that is) in the neighboring rooms going all night "bang on" "shudder off"! Another problem was with the staff --- we asked for a wake-up call at 4:30am but got it at 3:30am! Lost an entire hour of precious sleep! Worse, the caller did not announce the time when she called so we didn't even know until we had showered and dressed (therefore, fully awake) before we discovered the error! When we called to complain, she insisted we booked a 3:30 call! I wished the calls were taped!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Gabo13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just a couple of days and the whole experience was great. The girl at the front desk was very nice and the check in was quick. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel has a small gym and a pool, and also a little convenience store. The location is very good and we got a good price. I just liked the place a lot. I must say that the rooms only get cleaned once a week (or whenever someone checks out of course) but that was not a problem for us since we were there only for two days.

Reviews.Title: “Just FYI”
Reviews.Author: veintetre
Reviews.Content: If your boyfriend, husband is italian...dont go there. The old blonde woman at the front desk hit on my fiance right on my face. Very unprofessional behavior..though we took some advantage out of it. I think that once we get to a certain age, just like this lady, we should have a little of self respect.

Reviews.Title: “Good for price”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Knights
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we arrived in Miami for the start of our holiday. We stayed for 3 nights. You need a car here as its a bit off the beaten track, but there are plenty of places to park at the hotel. Nice room, clean and well appointed. Had all you need for a basic stay. Small pool but very cold. Early morning you could hear the planes fly over, but not too loud to disturb.

Reviews.Title: “Great for extended stay”
Reviews.Author: goo0325
Reviews.Content: I was in Miami for training and booked the Candlewood Suites. My room was well-appointed, clean and bed was of high quality. Room itself had a residential feel. Was like an apartment complex. The front desk service was superior and if I had to stay in Miami again for an extended period of time-- I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Doral Ale House and several restaurants were close by. Neighborhood was good.

Reviews.Title: “Mayberry in Miami”
Reviews.Author: etabunny
Reviews.Content: A simple life for a simple traveler. The rooms were very clean (everything was clean), the service was excellant, full kitchen, FREE internet access, a pull out couch for your quest. I was very pleased I had to go to Miami for the first time for business training. I will admit I was nervous because I was going 2000 miles away and I am female and was alone. But as soon as i got into the door it was home and a little piece of Mayberry. 'Hey Andy, can I get something from the fridge?' Sure just stop by there little market and get what every you need. THEY TRUST YOU! Just feel out a slip and drop it in the box and they charge your room. NICE! 'Hey Aunt Bee, can I wash some clothes?' Sure, just stop by the laudry faciltiles that they have and wash for FREE!. They even have laudnry soap. "Hey Opi, want to watch a movie?' Sure, just stop by the front desk and pick up any movie you want.. for FREE! HELLO! LITTLE PIECE OF HEAVEN. It was great to be in a place that trused you to be honest. It made me want to be overly appriciative and give me more. (Karma baby). (mayberry whistle) Thank you Candle suites..i will miss you but i promise I will come back, even if its in another town!

Reviews.Title: “A disapointment”
Reviews.Author: jdr1000
Reviews.Content: I hate to be the sour grape of the group but my experience at this property differs from all the recent reviews. I call them over the phone and asked if bedroom was separate from kitchen, they said yes and that all rooms where equal. So I booked the standard room and got a bed with a desk and a kitchen in front of it, no door separated the areas, if I had been told of this setup, the reservation would not be made . Dirty towels (black dirty), when asked for a change I was told to come back later since they did not have any to give me at the moment, baby insects in the bathroom, peculiar smell in the halls, unfriendly front desk girl. I really wanted to get out of there, and I did. Never going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, and Location”
Reviews.Author: jcsnCaracas
Reviews.Content: I had to be in Miami for just 2 days, and I found this hotel via Kayak.com. Even tough price was really good, I didn't made a reservation immediately. I made a research via Internet, with good results and then I completed my reservation on the hotel website. I must admit that I was not totally sure of my hotel choice. When Finally I arrived at the hotel, I was impressed. First of all, the location was unbeatable, the receptionist (a girl named Michell) was very helpful and with a very good attitude toward customers. The room was clean, in good conditions, with fast internet. As many reviewers stated here, there is no maid service every day, but since I was there for just 2 nights, It didn't bother me. Towels can be changed in the reception when you think y ou need to change it. Hotels has laundry machines, and you can get almost everything from their store via the honor system. Next time I am in Miami, I will be in Candlewood Suites again, and I will reccomend it to my friends

Reviews.Title: “No Maid Service Here”
Reviews.Author: Travelin'_Florida
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel on business weekly in Florida and we were shocked when we were looking at the motel rates in Miami. The first week in the area we decided to stay in Fort Lauderdale because the rates were much cheaper there. The second time in this area my husband chose this motel because the rates were much cheaper overall. We were shocked when we checked in to find that there wasn't any maid service available here unless you stay more than one week. One has to take their used towels down to the front desk to get clean ones every day. The rooms were very nice - like a studio apartment. They have very nice cooking utensils and appliances so you can cook in your room if you'd like to save money. They even have dishwashers in the rooms! Another nice amenity is their free washers and dryers; so bring your laundry detergent. You won't have to take home dirty clothes. They offer a little store to buy beverages, food, and snacks but the prices are outrageous! We had a few problems with maintenance issues and had to wait two whole days to have them repaired because they don't have a regular maintenance man on duty. They offer a free library of DVDs and video tapes.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My first experience at candlewood was absolutely great perfect hotel for a business woman that likes to cook since they have full kitchens. The staff is outstanding the manager was always available. Funny thing about this hotel is that they dont clean the rooms everyday just once a week. The hotel looks a bit old but is very clean, I stayed for 2 weeks and felt very much at home. I highly recomend the Candlewood miami ruuned by the cool handsome bald guy and his staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at this hotel and would recommend that anyone stay here, especially families. It is not close to any of the attractions, so those visiting the area without a car will have a difficult time. May not be so great for students just in town to party...but it may be worth the hassle because of the excellent price/quality compared to some of the south beach hotels that will allow you to be able to rent a car. The staff are pleasant, the rooms are a good size and comfortable, with an honor kitchen and launry available at the hotel. It was well work the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very worthwhile stay”
Reviews.Author: NROCHE
Reviews.Content: This location was PERFECT for what we were looking for. It is about 8 miles from the airport, but the planes are not a problem. We did not want to do the "beach thing" so this location was perfect for us. We had a one bedroomed suite that was exceptional value. Our 2 year old slept on a very comfortable sleeper couch in the lounge and we slept like babies in the bedroom next door. The hotel is upmarket and very good value for money. The washer and drier facilities are free, and the mini market works on an honour system (can you believe it in this day and age!). The staff were more than friendly. The pool was warm and we loved it. There is a free barbecue at the pool every Wednesday night and they provide all the food and you get to meet fellow travellers. Location was good for shopping and business meetings we had. For our next trip to Miami, this will be our choice.

HotelInfo.Name: Candlewood Suites Miami Airport West
HotelInfo.Address: 8855 NW 27th Street, Miami, FL 33172
